Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery vessel, probably a lid; interior glazed black; exterior: from top: rays; two black bands; black-figure head and right shoulder of youth to right (hair in added red and part of undetermined motif in red at nape of neck).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "14" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0830) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
